WorkItem.ClosedComment: Issue closed as it has been solved by the user.
WorkItem.Description:
I have a listbox and in it's datatemplate I hold a check box, I like to trigger a delegate command for MouseEnter, Mouse Leave event using PRISM's ICOmmand with my own behaviour. It's not at all recogonizing the event.
 
Whereas same Chackbox sitting on the page works fine with delegate commad.
 
So renderable items are supported by ICommand 
 
Correct me if I am wrong  or help me to fix this issue
 
-Muthu
EMC Corporation
WorkItem.Summary: ICommand not working with renderable items - Bug

Comments.Message: This one is working, when I add the datasource directly to the viewmodel! Sorry  for the issue raise :)
I mean binding the property to the datasource of the checkbox directly to define , that it is directly associated with the viewmodel and not the parent model.

Fixed by user.
